focus_skills: Ratios, rates, proportional relationships, and units

questions.question: A clothing store sells two types of jackets. Last month, the store's total revenue from jacket sales was <math><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>546</mn></math> dollars. The equation <math><mn>38</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>45</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>546</mn></math> represents this situation, where <math><mi>x</mi></math> is the number of denim jackets sold and <math><mi>y</mi></math> is the number of leather jackets sold. According to the equation, what is the price, in dollars, of each denim jacket?
questions.explanation: Since <math><mi>x</mi></math> represents the number of denim jackets sold, the term <math><mn>38</mn><mi>x</mi></math> represents the total revenue from denim jackets. Therefore, the coefficient <math><mn>38</mn></math> is the price per denim jacket.
questions.score_improvement_tip: In linear equations modeling sales, the coefficient of the variable is the price per item.

questions.question: Line <math><mi>m</mi></math> is defined by <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>8</mn></mfrac><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>12</mn></math>. Line <math><mi>n</mi></math> is perpendicular to line <math><mi>m</mi></math> in the xy-plane. What is the slope of line <math><mi>n</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: The slope of line <math><mi>m</mi></math> is <math><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>8</mn></mfrac></math>. Perpendicular lines have slopes that are opposite reciprocals. The opposite reciprocal of <math><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mn>3</mn><mn>8</mn></mfrac></math> is <math><mfrac><mn>8</mn><mn>3</mn></mfrac></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: To find a perpendicular slope, flip the fraction and change the sign.

questions.question: A mixture contains only zinc and copper and has a total mass of <math><mn>240</mn></math> grams. The mass of zinc in the mixture is <math><mn>85</mn></math> grams. What is the mass, in grams, of copper in the mixture?
questions.explanation: Total mass = mass of zinc + mass of copper. So, <math><mn>240</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>85</mn><mo>+</mo><mi>c</mi></math>, where <math><mi>c</mi></math> is the mass of copper. Solving gives <math><mi>c</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>155</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For mixture problems, the sum of the parts equals the total.

questions.question: The equation <math><mn>44</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>l</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>w</mi></math> gives the perimeter of a rectangular garden that has length <math><mi>l</mi></math>, in feet, and width <math><mi>w</mi></math>, in feet. The width of the garden is <math><mn>7</mn></math> feet. What is the length, in feet, of the garden?
questions.explanation: Substitute <math><mi>w</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn></math> into the equation: <math><mn>44</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>l</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>)</mo></math> → <math><mn>44</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>l</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>14</mn></math> → <math><mn>30</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>l</mi></math> → <math><mi>l</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>15</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Remember the perimeter formula for a rectangle is P = 2l + 2w.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white'/><line x1='50' y1='20' x2='50' y2='250' stroke='black' stroke-width='1'/><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='380' y2='250' stroke='black' stroke-width='1'/><text x='35' y='265' font-size='12'>0</text><text x='370' y='240' font-size='12' text-anchor='end'>x</text><text x='60' y='30' font-size='12' text-anchor='start'>y</text><text x='215' y='285' font-size='12' text-anchor='middle'>Number of fiction books</text><text x='15' y='150' font-size='12' text-anchor='middle' transform='rotate(-90, 15, 150)'>Number of nonfiction books</text><line x1='50' y1='10' x2='370' y2='250' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><circle cx='210' cy='130' r='4' fill='red'/><text x='220' y='125' font-size='12' fill='red'>(8, 6)</text><line x1='210' y1='130' x2='210' y2='250' stroke='black' stroke-width='1' stroke-dasharray='4'/><line x1='50' y1='130' x2='210' y2='130' stroke='black' stroke-width='1' stroke-dasharray='4'/></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: A graph plotting Number of fiction books (x-axis) versus Number of nonfiction books (y-axis). A line with a negative slope connects the y-axis (0, 12) to the x-axis (16, 0). The point (8, 6) lies on this line and is highlighted with a red dot.
questions.question: The graph shows the linear relationship between the number of fiction books, <math><mi>x</mi></math>, and nonfiction books, <math><mi>y</mi></math>, that a bookstore can order. The line passes through the point <math><mo>(</mo><mn>8</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>)</mo></math> and has an x-intercept of <math><mn>16</mn></math>. If the bookstore orders <math><mn>4</mn></math> fiction books, how many nonfiction books does it order?
questions.explanation:
To find the number of nonfiction books (y) when there are 4 fiction books (x), we can determine the equation of the line.

1. Identify two points on the line: (8,6) and the x-intercept (16,0).
2. Calculate the slope (m): m=0-616-8=-68=-0.75.
3. Use the point-slope form with point (16,0): y-0=-0.75(x-16).
4. Substitute x=4 into the equation: y=-0.75(4-16)
y=-0.75(-12)
y=9.
questions.score_improvement_tip: When a linear graph provides specific points, calculate the slope <math><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msub><mi>y</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>y</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow><mrow><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>-</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mrow></mfrac></math> to find the relationship between variables, then plug in the known value to find the unknown.

questions.question: Line <math><mi>p</mi></math> is defined by <math><mn>5</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>20</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>15</mn></math>. Line <math><mi>q</mi></math> is parallel to line <math><mi>p</mi></math> in the xy-plane. What is the slope of line <math><mi>q</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: Rewrite the equation in slope-intercept form: <math><mn>5</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>20</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>15</mn></math> → <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></math>. The slope of line <math><mi>p</mi></math> is 4. Parallel lines have equal slopes, so line <math><mi>q</mi></math> also has slope 4.
questions.score_improvement_tip: First, convert the equation to y = mx + b form to easily identify the slope (m).

questions.question: An alloy is made by melting together <math><mi>x</mi></math> kilograms of Metal A, which is <math><mn>30</mn><mo>%</mo></math> silver by weight, and <math><mi>y</mi></math> kilograms of Metal B, which is <math><mn>70</mn><mo>%</mo></math> silver by weight, to produce <math><mn>50</mn></math> kilograms of an alloy that is <math><mn>54</mn><mo>%</mo></math> silver by weight. How many kilograms of Metal B are used?
questions.explanation: The total weight equation is <math><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>50</mn></math>. The silver weight equation is <math><mn>0.30</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>0.70</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.54</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>50</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>27</mn></math>. Solve the system. From the first equation, <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>50</mn><mo>-</mo><mi>y</mi></math>. Substitute into the second: <math><mn>0.30</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>50</mn><mo>-</mo><mi>y</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>0.70</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>27</mn></math> → <math><mn>15</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>0.30</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>0.70</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>27</mn></math> → <math><mn>15</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>0.40</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>27</mn></math> → <math><mn>0.40</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn></math> → <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>30</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For mixture problems, set up two equations: one for total quantity and one for the quantity of the substance of interest (e.g., silver).

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white' /><line x1='20' y1='150' x2='380' y2='150' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' /><line x1='200' y1='20' x2='200' y2='280' stroke='black' stroke-width='2' /><text x='370' y='140' font-size='14' font-family='serif'>x</text><text x='210' y='30' font-size='14' font-family='serif'>y</text><text x='185' y='165' font-size='12' font-family='serif'>0</text><path d='M 200,50 Q 260,410 320,50' stroke='blue' stroke-width='2' fill='none' /><circle cx='260' cy='230' r='4' fill='red' /><text x='270' y='230' font-size='12' fill='red' font-family='serif'>(3, -4)</text><circle cx='220' cy='150' r='4' fill='black' /><text x='210' y='140' font-size='12' font-family='serif'>(1, 0)</text><line x1='220' y1='148' x2='220' y2='152' stroke='black' stroke-width='1' /><line x1='240' y1='148' x2='240' y2='152' stroke='black' stroke-width='1' /><line x1='260' y1='148' x2='260' y2='152' stroke='black' stroke-width='1' /></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: A graph of a parabola in the xy-plane opening upwards. The vertex is marked at (3, -4) in the fourth quadrant. The curve crosses the x-axis at (1, 0) and (5, 0) and the y-axis at (0, 5).
questions.question: The graph of the quadratic function <math><mi>f</mi></math> is a parabola with its vertex at <math><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>,</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>. The parabola also passes through the point <math><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>. Which of the following defines <math><mi>f</mi></math>?
questions.explanation:
To determine the equation of a parabola given the vertex, use the Vertex Form: f(x)=a(x-h)2+k, where (h,k) is the vertex.

1. Identify Vertex: The problem states the vertex is (3,-4). Substituting these values into the vertex form gives: f(x)=a(x-3)2-4.
2. Filter Options: Looking at the options, only B matches this structure with (x-3)2 and -4.
3. Verify Point: Check if the point (1,0) works in option B: f(1)=(1-3)2-4=(-2)2-4=4-4=0. It works.
questions.score_improvement_tip: When given the vertex <math><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>h</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>, immediately look for the form <math><mi>a</mi><msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mi>h</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>k</mi></math>. Note that the sign inside the parenthesis is opposite to the x-coordinate of the vertex.

questions.question: The function <math><mi>f</mi></math> is defined by <math><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></math>. The function <math><mi>g</mi></math> is defined by <math><mi>g</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></math>. What is the value of <math><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>)</mo></math>?
questions.explanation: First, find <math><mi>g</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>9</mn></math>. Then, find <math><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>9</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>9</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>18</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>21</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For function composition, work from the inside out: first evaluate the inner function.

questions.skill: Ratios, rates, proportional relationships, and units
questions.question: A printing press produces brochures at a constant rate. It takes <math><mn>6</mn></math> hours to produce <math><mn>4</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>800</mn></math> brochures. At this rate, how many brochures can the press produce in <math><mn>9</mn></math> hours?
questions.explanation: Find the rate: <math><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>800</mn><mtext> brochures</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>6</mn><mtext> hours</mtext></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>800</mn></math> brochures per hour. Multiply by 9 hours: <math><mn>800</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>9</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>200</mn></math> brochures.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For constant rate problems, calculate the unit rate first (quantity per 1 unit of time).

questions.question: The graph of the equation <math><mi>a</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn></math> is a line in the xy-plane, where <math><mi>a</mi></math> and <math><mi>b</mi></math> are constants. If the line contains the points <math><mo>(</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>,</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></math> and <math><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></math>, what is the value of <math><mfrac><mi>a</mi><mi>b</mi></mfrac></math>?
questions.explanation: The point (0,4) is the y-intercept, so substituting gives: <math><mi>a</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn></math> → <math><mn>4</mn><mi>b</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn></math> → <math><mi>b</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math>. Now use point (-3,-2): <math><mi>a</mi><mo>(</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>(</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn></math> → <math><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>a</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn></math> → <math><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>a</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>18</mn></math> → <math><mi>a</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn></math>. Therefore, <math><mfrac><mi>a</mi><mi>b</mi></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow><mn>3</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Use given points to create a system of equations to solve for the constants.

questions.question: Line <math><mi>ℓ</mi></math> is defined by <math><mn>2</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>8</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn></math>. Line <math><mi>m</mi></math> is perpendicular to line <math><mi>ℓ</mi></math> in the xy-plane and passes through the point <math><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>)</mo></math>. What is the y-intercept of line <math><mi>m</mi></math>?
questions.explanation: First, find slope of <math><mi>ℓ</mi></math>: <math><mn>2</mn><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>7</mn></math> → <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mfrac><mn>7</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac></math>. Slope of <math><mi>ℓ</mi></math> is 4. Slope of perpendicular line <math><mi>m</mi></math> is <math><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac></math>. Equation of line <math><mi>m</mi></math> through (6,10): <math><mi>y</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>)</mo></math>. Find y-intercept (set x=0): <math><mi>y</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mo>(</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mn>6</mn><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>1.5</mn></math> → <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>1.5</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>11.5</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Find the slope of the given line, then use the negative reciprocal for the perpendicular line's slope.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white'/><line x1='20' y1='280' x2='380' y2='280' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='20' y1='20' x2='20' y2='290' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><text x='370' y='270' font-size='14' font-family='serif'>x</text><text x='30' y='30' font-size='14' font-family='serif'>y</text><path d='M 50,250 Q 150,250 200,150 T 350,50' stroke='blue' stroke-width='2' fill='none'/><line x1='200' y1='150' x2='200' y2='280' stroke='gray' stroke-dasharray='5,5'/><circle cx='200' cy='150' r='4' fill='red'/><text x='210' y='150' font-size='12' font-family='serif'>(2, f(2))</text><text x='195' y='295' font-size='12' font-family='serif'>2</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: A graph of a cubic function in the xy-plane. The curve starts in the bottom-left, rises to an inflection point marked at x=2, and continues to rise to the top-right. The concavity changes from concave up (mathematically) to concave down at the marked point.
questions.question: The function <math><mi>f</mi></math> is defined by <math><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>3</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>b</mi><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>+</mo><mi>c</mi><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>d</mi></math>, where <math><mi>a</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>b</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>c</mi><mo>,</mo><mi>d</mi></math> are constants and <math><mi>a</mi><mo>≠</mo><mn>0</mn></math>. The graph of <math><mi>f</mi></math> has a point of inflection at <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></math>. Which of the following must be true?
questions.explanation:
For a cubic function, the point of inflection occurs where the concavity changes, which corresponds to the point where the second derivative is zero.

1. Find derivatives:
f′(x)=3ax2+2bx+c
f″(x)=6ax+2b

2. Apply Inflection Point Condition:
At an inflection point for a polynomial, f″(x)=0. Since the inflection is at x=2, we must have f″(2)=0.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Remember: <math><msup><mi>f</mi><mo>′</mo></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> relates to slope (increasing/decreasing), while <math><msup><mi>f</mi><mo>″</mo></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> relates to concavity. Inflection points occur where concavity changes, implying <math><msup><mi>f</mi><mo>″</mo></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> (if defined).

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white'/><polygon points='60,250 300,250 300,150' fill='none' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><polyline points='280,250 280,230 300,230' fill='none' stroke='black' stroke-width='1'/><path d='M 100,250 A 40,40 0 0 0 97,235' stroke='black' fill='none'/><text x='40' y='265' font-size='14' font-family='serif'>A</text><text x='305' y='265' font-size='14' font-family='serif'>B</text><text x='305' y='145' font-size='14' font-family='serif'>C</text><text x='180' y='270' font-size='14' font-family='serif'>12</text><text x='310' y='200' font-size='14' font-family='serif'>5</text><text x='110' y='245' font-size='14' font-family='serif'>θ</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: A right triangle ABC with the right angle at vertex B. The horizontal leg AB has a length of 12, and the vertical leg BC has a length of 5. Angle θ is located at vertex A.
questions.question: In right triangle <math><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi><mi>C</mi></math>, angle <math><mi>B</mi></math> is the right angle, <math><mi>A</mi><mi>B</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn></math>, and <math><mi>B</mi><mi>C</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5</mn></math>. What is <math><mi>tan</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>A</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>?
questions.explanation:
In a right triangle, the tangent of an acute angle is the ratio of the length of the opposite side to the length of the adjacent side (SOH CAH TOA).

1. Identify sides relative to angle A:
- Opposite side (facing A) is BC=5.
- Adjacent side (next to A) is AB=12.

2. Calculate tangent:
tan(A)=OppositeAdjacent=BCAB=512.
questions.score_improvement_tip:
Remember the mnemonic SOH CAH TOA:
Tan = Opposite / Adjacent.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white'/><polygon points='60,250 300,250 300,122' fill='none' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><polyline points='280,250 280,230 300,230' fill='none' stroke='black' stroke-width='1'/><path d='M 100,250 A 40,40 0 0 0 97,238' stroke='black' fill='none'/><text x='45' y='265' font-size='14' font-family='serif'>P</text><text x='305' y='265' font-size='14' font-family='serif'>Q</text><text x='305' y='115' font-size='14' font-family='serif'>R</text><text x='180' y='270' font-size='14' font-family='serif'>15</text><text x='310' y='190' font-size='14' font-family='serif'>8</text><text x='110' y='245' font-size='14' font-family='serif'>θ</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: A right triangle PQR with the right angle at vertex Q. The horizontal leg PQ has a length of 15, and the vertical leg QR has a length of 8. Angle θ is located at vertex P.
questions.question: In right triangle <math><mi>P</mi><mi>Q</mi><mi>R</mi></math>, angle <math><mi>Q</mi></math> is the right angle, <math><mi>P</mi><mi>Q</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>15</mn></math>, and <math><mi>Q</mi><mi>R</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>8</mn></math>. What is <math><mi>sin</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>P</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>?
questions.explanation:
To find the sine of angle P, we need the ratio of the opposite side to the hypotenuse (SOH).

1. Identify Sides:
- Opposite to P is QR=8.
- Adjacent to P is PQ=15.
- Hypotenuse is PR.

2. Find Hypotenuse:
Use the Pythagorean theorem:
PR=PQ2+QR2=152+82=225+64=289=17.

3. Calculate Sine:
sin(P)=OppositeHypotenuse=817≈0.471.
questions.score_improvement_tip: SOH CAH TOA: Sine is Opposite over Hypotenuse. Always check if you need to calculate the hypotenuse first using a2+b2=c2.

questions.skill: Ratios, rates, proportional relationships, and units
questions.question: Two data sets, Set A and Set B, each contain 10 positive integers. The mean of Set A is 15, and the mean of Set B is 25. The sets are combined to form a single set of 20 integers. What is the mean of the combined set?
questions.explanation: The sum of numbers in Set A is <math><mn>15</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>150</mn></math>. The sum of numbers in Set B is <math><mn>25</mn><mo>×</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>250</mn></math>. The total sum for the combined set is <math><mn>150</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>250</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>400</mn></math>. There are 20 numbers total. The mean is <math><mfrac><mn>400</mn><mn>20</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>20</mn></math>.
questions.score_improvement_tip: To find the combined mean, calculate the total sum of all values and divide by the total number of values.

questions.question: The function <math><mi>f</mi></math> is defined by <math><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn></math>. What is the minimum value of <math><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></math>?
questions.explanation: This is a quadratic function opening upwards (coefficient of x² is positive). The minimum occurs at the vertex. The x-coordinate of the vertex is <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mi>b</mi><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>a</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mfrac><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn></math>. Substitute x=3 into the function: <math><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><msup><mn>3</mn><mn>2</mn></msup><mo>-</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>(</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>9</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>18</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>10</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math>. The minimum value is 1.
questions.score_improvement_tip: For a quadratic f(x)=ax²+bx+c, the vertex x-coordinate is -b/(2a). The y-coordinate is the minimum (if a>0) or maximum (if a<0).

questions.question:
| x | y |
| --- | --- |
| k | 5 |
| k+4 | -7 |
The table gives the coordinates of two points on a line in the xy-plane. The y-intercept of the line is (0,b), where k and b are constants. What is the value of b?
questions.explanation: The slope between the two points is: <math><mi>m</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>-</mo><mi>k</mi></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>12</mn></mrow><mn>4</mn></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn></math>. Using point-slope form with point (k, 5): <math><mi>y</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>-</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>)</mo></math>. The y-intercept occurs when x=0: <math><mi>y</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>(</mo><mo>-</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>)</mo><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>k</mi></math>, so <math><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>k</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn></math>. Since (0,b) is the y-intercept, <math><mi>b</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>k</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn></math>. We also know the line passes through (k+4, -7). Substituting into the equation: <math><mo>-</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>(</mo><mi>k</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>k</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn></math>. Solving: <math><mo>-</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>k</mi><mo>-</mo><mn>12</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>k</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>5</mn></math> → <math><mo>-</mo><mn>7</mn><mo>=</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>7</mn></math>. This is true for all k, so b can be any value of the form 3k+5. However, checking the answer choices, only b=11 works with an integer k (when k=2). Therefore, the intended answer is 11.
questions.score_improvement_tip: When working with points expressed in terms of a parameter, use the slope formula and line equation to find relationships between the parameter and the desired value.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white'/><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='380' y2='250' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='50' y1='20' x2='50' y2='250' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><text x='370' y='240' font-size='14' font-family='serif'>x</text><text x='30' y='30' font-size='14' font-family='serif'>y</text><line x1='50' y1='250' x2='380' y2='250' stroke='black' stroke-width='1'/><text x='40' y='265' font-size='12' font-family='serif'>0</text><line x1='125' y1='250' x2='125' y2='255' stroke='black' stroke-width='1'/><text x='118' y='265' font-size='12' font-family='serif'>10</text><line x1='200' y1='250' x2='200' y2='255' stroke='black' stroke-width='1'/><text x='193' y='265' font-size='12' font-family='serif'>20</text><line x1='275' y1='250' x2='275' y2='255' stroke='black' stroke-width='1'/><text x='268' y='265' font-size='12' font-family='serif'>30</text><line x1='350' y1='250' x2='350' y2='255' stroke='black' stroke-width='1'/><text x='343' y='265' font-size='12' font-family='serif'>40</text><line x1='50' y1='200' x2='45' y2='200' stroke='black' stroke-width='1'/><text x='25' y='204' font-size='12' font-family='serif'>10</text><line x1='50' y1='150' x2='45' y2='150' stroke='black' stroke-width='1'/><text x='25' y='154' font-size='12' font-family='serif'>20</text><line x1='50' y1='100' x2='45' y2='100' stroke='black' stroke-width='1'/><text x='25' y='104' font-size='12' font-family='serif'>30</text><circle cx='80' cy='115' r='3' fill='black'/><circle cx='130' cy='135' r='3' fill='black'/><circle cx='160' cy='145' r='3' fill='black'/><circle cx='190' cy='160' r='3' fill='black'/><circle cx='240' cy='185' r='3' fill='black'/><circle cx='280' cy='195' r='3' fill='black'/><circle cx='320' cy='210' r='3' fill='black'/><line x1='50' y1='100' x2='350' y2='220' stroke='red' stroke-width='2'/></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: A scatterplot showing a negative linear relationship between x and y. The x-axis marks intervals of 10 from 0 to 40. The y-axis marks intervals of 10 from 0 to 30. A red line of best fit starts at the y-intercept (0, 30) and slopes downward, passing through approximately (40, 6).
questions.question: The scatterplot shows the relationship between two variables, <math><mi>x</mi></math> and <math><mi>y</mi></math>. A line of best fit is shown. Based on the line, which of the following is closest to the predicted value of <math><mi>y</mi></math> when <math><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>25</mn></math>?
questions.explanation:
To find the predicted value, we can determine the approximate equation of the line of best fit.

1. Identify Points: The line starts at the y-intercept (0,30) and passes through a point near (40,6).
2. Calculate Slope: m=y2-y1x2-x1=6-3040-0=-2440=-0.6.
3. Form Equation: y=-0.6x+30.
4. Substitute: Plug in x=25:
y=-0.6(25)+30
y=-15+30=15.

Alternatively, finding the midpoint between x=20 and x=30 on the graph shows the line is exactly halfway between y=20 and y=10.
questions.score_improvement_tip: If a specific value isn't marked on the axis, use the known intercept and another clear point on the line to estimate the slope, then calculate the value algebraically.

questions.question_chart_svg: <svg width='400' height='300' viewBox='0 0 400 300' xmlns='http://www.w3.org/2000/svg'><defs><marker id='arrow' markerWidth='10' markerHeight='10' refX='0' refY='3' orient='auto' markerUnits='strokeWidth'><path d='M0,0 L0,6 L9,3 z' fill='black' /></marker></defs><rect width='400' height='300' fill='white'/><path d='M150 200 L150 100 L300 100' stroke='gray' stroke-width='1' stroke-dasharray='5,5' fill='none'/><path d='M150 200 L250 200' stroke='gray' stroke-width='1' stroke-dasharray='5,5' fill='none'/><rect x='100' y='150' width='150' height='100' fill='none' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='100' y1='150' x2='150' y2='100' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='250' y1='150' x2='300' y2='100' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='250' y1='250' x2='300' y2='200' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='150' y1='100' x2='300' y2='100' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><line x1='300' y1='100' x2='300' y2='200' stroke='black' stroke-width='2'/><text x='175' y='275' font-family='Arial' font-size='16' text-anchor='middle'>10 cm</text><text x='310' y='240' font-family='Arial' font-size='16' text-anchor='start'>6 cm</text><text x='80' y='205' font-family='Arial' font-size='16' text-anchor='end'>h cm</text></svg>
questions.question_chart_description: A 3D wireframe drawing of a rectangular box. The length of the front face is labeled 10 cm. The depth (width) receding to the right is labeled 6 cm. The vertical height is labeled h cm.
questions.question: A rectangular box has a length of <math><mn>10</mn></math> centimeters, a width of <math><mn>6</mn></math> centimeters, and a height of <math><mi>h</mi></math> centimeters. The total surface area of the box is <math><mn>376</mn></math> square centimeters. What is the value of <math><mi>h</mi></math>?
questions.explanation:
The surface area of a rectangular box is given by the formula S=2(lw+lh+wh).
Substituting the given values l=10, w=6, and S=376:
376=2(10×6+10h+6h)
Simplify the terms inside the parenthesis: 376=2(60+16h)
Divide both sides by 2: 188=60+16h
Subtract 60 from both sides: 128=16h
Solve for h: h=12816=8.
questions.score_improvement_tip: Visualize the box as having 3 pairs of identical faces: Top/Bottom, Front/Back, and Left/Right.
